thread.title: Cougs starting to get bowl predictions
thread.title_full: Cougs starting to get bowl predictions

author: Stephanie Loh, The Seattle Times
title: Cougs starting to get bowl predictions
text: Cougs starting to get bowl predictions Stephanie Loh, The Seattle Times Print this article Advertisement Washington State’s slew of afternoon kickoffs will continue at least through Game 7 at Arizona. The Cougars vs. Wildcats contest will kick off at 1 p.m. on the Pac-12 Network. Meanwhile, ESPN.com’s Kevin Gemmell named Luke Falk the Pac-12 offensive player of the week, but the Pac-12 chose to bestow that honor upon Utah running back Devontae Booker. Jacob Thorpe says the Cougars will never play a “complete” game but that Saturday was pretty darn good. With the Oregon win, the Cougars are starting to garner some bowl buzz. ESPN.com’s Kyle Bonagura predicts WSU will get an at-large bowl bid, Brett McMurphy thinks WSU will end up in the Zaxby’s Heart of Dallas Bowl on Dec. 26, playing Louisiana-Lafayette. Mark Schlabach, however, has WSU slated for the Camping World Independence Bowl in Shreveport, La., against Bobby Petriono’s Louisville squad. Wanna bet Idaho coach Paul Petrino will come out to Louisiana for that one? The Oregonian’s Gina Mizell, who covers Oregon State, has this sneak peak at the upcoming match up — WSU vs. Oregon State. Main takeaway from her observations: “The Cougars are beatable, but not if the Beavers’ offense can’t find traction and the defense can’t stop missing tackles in space and allowing explosive plays in the secondary.” The Cougars have moved up in ESPN.com’s Pac-12 Power Rankings. They’re now No. 7.
